snippet: Mr. Scott, whose plaintive delivery earned him a following that included other vocalists like Madonna, Marvin Gaye and Frankie Valli, spent most of his career in relative obscurity before gaining wider appreciation in recent years.
abstract: Jimmy Scott, jazz singer whose distinctively plaintive delivery and unusually high-pitched voice earned him loyal following and, late in life, a taste of bona fide stardom, dies at age 88.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Scott, whose plaintive delivery earned him a following that included other vocalists like Madonna, Marvin Gaye and Frankie Valli, spent most of his career in relative obscurity before gaining wider appreciation in recent years.

headline.main: Jimmy Scott, Singer Whose Star Rose Late, Dies at 88
headline.print_headline: Jimmy Scott, 88, Singer Whose Star Rose Late, Dies
